_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Readington Farms, Inc has implemented an accidental release prevention program that includes process safety information according to a documentation plan.

Readington Farms, Inc. policy is to prevent an accidental release by using state-of-the art technology, maintaining the system to the highest degree of mechanical integrity, training the EHS operators to the highest degree of awareness and having the latest safety equipment available to them to respond to an accidental release.

Readington Farms, Inc. has trained EHS/HAZMAT operators to respond to accidental releases in conjunction with offsite responders such as, Hunterdon County Hazmat Team, Whitehouse Fire and Rescue and the Readington Township Office of Emergency Management (LEPC) of Whitehouse, NJ.

Readington Farms Inc.emergency response program is updated according to the needs of our facility.  This includes equipment training, response procedures, notification and procedures for periodic drills.  

Readington Farms, Inc. facility is in Whitehouse, NJ located in a rual area on 12 Mill Road approximately 1500 feet north of Highway 22.  South of Interstate I-78.  East of County Road 523.

Seven thousand five hundred pounds of anhydrous ammonia (NH3) is registered to be used in the ammonia refrigeration system to cool all Readington Farms, Inc. products that include milk, juice and drinks.  The process is a standard refrigeration system built to ANSI/ASHRAE and IIAR recognized codes and practices

Release prevention and chemical specific prevention used in the process at Readington Farms, Inc. is state-of-the-art technology with relief valves, manual shutoff, interlocks, alarms and procedures, grounding equipment, excess flow devices.  Mitigation measures used are fogging hoses.  The process areas are monitored by leak detection systems interlocked with process flow feed valves.  Operator refresher training and system update training are conducted in the prescribed basis of the operator training program.  Th

e maintenance program conducts the equipment reliability studies to insure operation of the prevention devices.

Readington Farms, Inc. also complies with OSHA and Insurance company regulations, audits and inspections.  Also, with the State of New Jersey licensing for refrigeration systems operators.

Operating procedures at Readington Farms, Inc. insure that the process is monitored on a continuous basis.  The entire program is overseen by the TCPA responsible manager.

There is a program in place to implement that if any incidents occurred they would be investigated to determine root cause and system deficiency.  Corrective actions will be monitored until completed.

Readington Farms, Inc. have no accidents on record to report within the last five years. The accident investigation program includes steps for all incidents to be investigated for root cause and system deficiency correction.

Readington Farms, Inc. emergency response plan was designed and updated according to the needs of our facility.  The plan defines the response organization, coordination with local Township of Readington Office of Emergency Management response committee (LEPC) response procedures, safety equipment training, notification procedures and drills.  The plan is updated according to the recommendations resulting from system deficiencies uncovered by the periodic drills. 

Planned safety improvements will include training of EHS operators and working towards inherently safer technology.
